subject: On Sale Today
event: WARRIORS was officially released today, and should be available at your favorite local bookstore. For the latest adventure of Dunk & Egg, a new Lord John story from Diana Gabaldon, an Emberverse tale from S.M. Stirling, and original stories by Joe Haldeman, Howard Waldrop, David Morrell, Tad William, Naomi Novik, Lawrence Block, James Rollins, Robin Hobb, and many many others, go ye forth and snag a copy. Enjoy the read!

comments.upictitle: Popular series of fiction, fancy, and fact.: Benevolent sense of life
comments.article: I can't believe you forewent the opportunity to use the subject line: "Warriors Come Out And Play".
THIS.
Heading now to pick it up. Also I was always meaning to ask this but was Robin Hobb the inspiration behind the character named Three-Fingered Hobb?
comments.subject: Excited

comments.article: This was your best Dunk/Egg story so far.  And I dare say that some hints about what may happen in Ice/Fire seem to be contained within...
comments.subject: Already did

comments.article: Amazon says mine is on the way! WOO! I can't WAIT!!!!

Dunk!! Can't wait to read it George.

Do you know yet if MYSTERY KNIGHT is getting the audio book treatment?
My birthday is in a couple daze ~ and "Warriors" is on the top of my gift list from my family.  Can't wait to dive back into the adventures of Dunk & Egg.  THANKS!
comments.subject: Excellent!

comments.upictitle: Mole: fashion smart vain looking good
comments.article: In the UK too?
There's no British edition, but you can get it mailorder via Amazon or other online bookshops.
Gonna go out and grab this right now.  Love Dunk & Egg.
Thanks for the new Dunk & Egg story.  I love the heraldry in these stories and your descriptions of the knights.  I tried to read a couple of the other stories but alas they pale in comparison.
comments.subject: Mystery Knight was a good read.

comments.article: I've been getting pretty psyched about this collection - gotta go pick up a copy after work!
I've had mine sitting next to me on my desk all day.  Can't wait to get off work.
Do you know if there will be a Kindle version?
There sure is one. I bought it earlier today.
comments.subject: Kindle version?

comments.article:
I ordered through Amazon and they sent notice that they were shipping on Sunday, but from Kentucky, which unfortunately is not too close to where I live.

I had no trouble waiting as long as necessary for the book to be finished, but now that it's here, the few days I have to wait is killing me. (The mind works in strange ways sometimes).
comments.subject: Anxiously awaiting mine.

comments.article:
Glendon Flowers - Knight of the Pussywillows.
*laughs*

Great characters. Thanks for the back story.

I'm enjoying some of the other stories too. (Of course)

I also loved your intro. Couldn't agree more.

I'll see if I can track each of you for a signing.
Twould be an impressive book then with all those signatures.
comments.subject: Loved the story, loving the book

comments.article:
The hedge knight was the first thing i ever ready by you. your by far my favorite author. A new dunk and egg novel and HBO green lighting A GAME OF THRONES things just cant get any better.

I took the day off work tomorrow because that is when my copy of warriors arrives from Amazon. I read somewhere that there is a two year holding period before the story can be made into a comic (this is a good idea everyone should read the real story before they read the comic) so in two years I should be able to buy the comic version of THE MYSTERY KNIGHT right? O.K. enough rambling.

what I really wanted to ask about its digital versions of the graphic novels. I got a few apps for my iphone that let you buy and read comics. The one i really like just put out an email that marvel comics are now fully supported in this format. So will I get to download the graphic novel versions of THE HEDGE KNIGHT and THE SWORN SWORD on my phone some time in the near future?
comments.subject: the hedge knight

comments.article: And I loved it! I love Dunk and Egg. :)
comments.subject: Done!!

comments.article: I grabbed mine at Borders yesterday.  I had to hunt around a bit for it, but eventually came across a few copies!

Great collection. Not a bad story in the book.

Although an enjoyable and well written story, I felt the "Clean Slate" link to the central theme was a bit tenuous. How did you and Gardner decide that it fit?
comments.subject: Bloch Story

comments.article:
Loved the Dunk and Egg story! LOVED IT. It was great to get to go back to Westeros, even if it isn't 1300 pages worth yet, or whatever Dance turns out to be.

Now for the rest of the book before going back to read it again...
...and to think I was upset with my local B&N for not having Warriors when I checked yesterday. I had misread and thought it was out already.

comments.upictitle: He wasn't looking for a five minute thrill: Default / Itsa Me!
comments.article:
Picked a copy up and can't wait to dig in, but a quick question...

Why is the book jacket different from your picture in this post? You're not listed as an author on the cover I have, just as editor. Weird.

~R

I just "picked up" my copy of Warriors via my Kindle DX.

I have to say that I buy a hell of a lot more books with my Kindle than I ever did at the store.

Loving it so far. Who can resist an Anthology edited by Dozois and George R.R. Martin?

By the way, does anyone know if Kindle purchases count toward NYT Hardcover bestsellers? I hope Amazon reports my Kindle purchase as +1 toward Warriors hitting the NYT HC Best Seller list.
comments.subject: Kindle Edition of Warriors

comments.article: Can't find a Kindle edition listed on Amazon.  How did you find it?
comments.subject: Re: Kindle Edition of Warriors

comments.article: hope I'll be able to read it in Russian this year )

Got my copy.  Barnes and Noble had it hidden away somewhere.  went into the store, looked everywhere and couldn't find it.  Had to call from work and have them pull it and hold it for me.  Picked it up at lunch time.  3 stories into it and so for it's excellent reading.  I'm up to the part with the eyelids cut off.  Good job, George!!!
Went right to my kindle, love this book already.  I also very much enjoy your introduction.
